programme.title: En livsreise
programme.desc: En livsreise. De første ukene av livet er verden et skummelt sted. Farer lurer bak hvert hjørne, og det lønner seg å være på vakt, uansett om man er rovdyr eller bytte. Hver dag kan være den siste. Man må skynde seg å bli voksen, for selv de største dyrene er sårbare for angrep.

programme.title: En livsreise
programme.desc: En livsreise. Hvis unge dyr klarer seg til de blir voksne, har de mye større sjanse for å overleve – men de møter mange utfordringer før de kan gå sine egne veier. Noen bruker måneder på å vokse opp, andre flere tiår, men alle har mye de må lære på veien, fra å bli kjent med kroppen sin og lære seg å skaffe mat selv, til å øve på å slåss og lære hvordan man får venner. De møter mange hindringer på veien, men hver eneste lille seier kan være forskjellen på liv og død.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Jaguarungen Frida tester grenser og finpusser overlevelsesevnene sine i Caiman Lodge naturreservat i Brasil. Hun lærer seg å snike seg fram sammen med mamma Gatuna, får hjelp av søster Anouk til å gjemme seg for sultne inntrengere, og tar en dumdristig tur alene som heldigvis ender godt.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Sjøløven Lola tar sine første kaotiske steg inn på en mannsdominert slagmark på kysten av Argentina. Den unge sjøløven lærer seg livsviktige kommunikasjons- og svømmeferdigheter, kjemper for å bli hos moren Maria, og unnslipper så vidt et sett skarpe tenner.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Føl fortryllelsen av Brasils Atlanterhavsskog når ulledderkoppen Dora tar sine første skritt bort fra mamma Mimi. Få leksjoner i apedynamikk, øv deg på halehengingsteknikk, og se denne babyen finne sin plass blant jevnaldrende.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Sett kursen mot eventyr med Thiago, en modig nesebjørn. Finn ut hvordan denne vaskebjørn-lignende karen skjerper sine snuse- og leteferdigheter, krysser forstadsveier i nærheten av sitt frodige brasilianske skoghjem og unngår livløse og firbeinte farer.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Besøk den siste høyborgen til den gigantiske elveoteren i Brasils vakre Pantanal-våtmark. Spor valpen Rio og søsknene hans mens de tester vannet, slår seg sammen for å unngå et angrep fra jaguarer og bli en familieenhet som jakter og vokser sammen.

programme.title: Vulkanske reiser
programme.desc: Vulkanske reiser. Danakilfordypningen i Etiopia er ikke bare et av verdens mest ugjestmilde steder, men også et av de mest geologisk aktive. Nå tar vulkanologen Tom Pfeiffer en gruppe opplevelsesturister med for å krysse Danakil for å se vulkanen Erte Ale.

programme.title: Afrikas skjulte riker
programme.desc: Afrikas skjulte riker. En smal og ugjestmild landstripe langs vestkysten av det sørlige Afrika er full av kontraster der faunaen er nødt til å tilpasse seg for å overleve. Møt de særegne og karismatiske beboerne som hører hjemme i dette skjøre samspillet mellom land og hav.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Brasil har en mangfoldig kystlinje som strekker seg over 8045 km. og har fem av de seks brasilianske biomene. Blått og grønt vann, endeløse strender, hundrevis av øyer, steinete kyster, sanddyner, elvemunninger og bukter gjør dette til et av de rikeste landskapene i verden. Det er hjemmet til mange endemiske arter som ikke finnes andre steder. Møt de engasjerte menneskene som kjemper en daglig kamp for å redde denne rike arven: den brasilianske kystlinjen. I sørenden av Pantanal, verdens største tropiske våtmarksområde, finnes det et helt unikt sted og et dyreliv som er så mangfoldig at forskerne sliter med å forstå alle måtene dyrene samhandler med hverandre på. Høylandet i Bodoquena Hills er inngangen til de grumsete våtmarkene i Pantanal. Her er vannet krystallklart, filtrert av en kalksteinsformasjon gjennom 600 millioner år, og gir et klart vindu til livet i disse elvene. Her er fossefall, kalktuffdemninger, huler og uberørte elver med sikt opptil femti meter.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Brasil har en mangfoldig kystlinje som strekker seg over 8045 km. og har fem av de seks brasilianske biomene. Blått og grønt vann, endeløse strender, hundrevis av øyer, steinete kyster, sanddyner, elvemunninger og bukter gjør dette til et av de rikeste landskapene i verden. Det er hjemmet til mange endemiske arter som ikke finnes andre steder. Møt de engasjerte menneskene som kjemper en daglig kamp for å redde denne rike arven: den brasilianske kystlinjen. Hvert år blir våtmarkene sør i Pantanal et paradis for fugler når over 650 arter av sjeldne og ikoniske fugler samles her i paringstiden.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Brasil har en mangfoldig kystlinje som strekker seg over 8045 km. og har fem av de seks brasilianske biomene. Blått og grønt vann, endeløse strender, hundrevis av øyer, steinete kyster, sanddyner, elvemunninger og bukter gjør dette til et av de rikeste landskapene i verden. Det er hjemmet til mange endemiske arter som ikke finnes andre steder. Møt de engasjerte menneskene som kjemper en daglig kamp for å redde denne rike arven: den brasilianske kystlinjen. I hjertet av våtmarksområdet Pantanal finnes det en region som er så avsidesliggende at svært få mennesker noensinne drar dit. Mangelen på påvirkning fra mennesker gjør dette til et perfekt habitat for en vilter flokk på 300 hvitleppede navlesvin. Disse store, griselignende pattedyrene kan bli opptil 45 kilo, og har striper av hvit pels under haken. Dette har gitt dem det karakteristiske utseendet og navnet.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Brasil har en mangfoldig kystlinje som strekker seg over 8045 km. og har fem av de seks brasilianske biomene. Blått og grønt vann, endeløse strender, hundrevis av øyer, steinete kyster, sanddyner, elvemunninger og bukter gjør dette til et av de rikeste landskapene i verden. Det er hjemmet til mange endemiske arter som ikke finnes andre steder. Møt de engasjerte menneskene som kjemper en daglig kamp for å redde denne rike arven: den brasilianske kystlinjen. I hjertet av Brasil regjerer Amerikas største katt, den storslåtte jaguaren, over et magisk land fullt av naturlig skjønnhet og mangfold.

programme.title: Brazil Untamed
programme.desc: Brasil har en mangfoldig kystlinje som strekker seg over 8045 km. og har fem av de seks brasilianske biomene. Blått og grønt vann, endeløse strender, hundrevis av øyer, steinete kyster, sanddyner, elvemunninger og bukter gjør dette til et av de rikeste landskapene i verden. Det er hjemmet til mange endemiske arter som ikke finnes andre steder. Møt de engasjerte menneskene som kjemper en daglig kamp for å redde denne rike arven: den brasilianske kystlinjen. Den sårbare og sky ozeloten er utrydningstruet i mange land, men i sørenden av Pantanal, et av verdens største tropiske våtmarksområder, ser det ut til at denne flotte villkatten er i ferd med å komme tilbake. En gruppe unge villdyrforskere prøver å forstå hvorfor.

programme.title: Villmarkens voktere
programme.desc: Villmarkens voktere. Kasanka nasjonalpark i Zambia huser en uvanlig bavianart. Kindabavianene har vendt seg bort fra den aggressive formen for dominans som vanligvis forbindes med disse store apene, og lever et mye fredeligere liv. En engasjert gruppe forskere lever sammen med en av flokkene for å avsløre hemmelighetene deres og prøve å forstå hva som gjør dem så spesielle.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Gruppe to får leke i vannet når de besøker det oversvømte klasserommet til gruppe tre. Ayu, Ruthie og Kesi nærmer seg å bli sluppet fri. Når Alba – verdens sjeldneste orangutang – ankommer, blir det en sensasjon på jungelskolen.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Nå som albinoorangutangen Alba er her, hvordan vil klassekameratene hennes reagere? Få en omvisning i barnehagen, se hvordan Beni håndterer en stor bølle, og følg med når noen tøffe hunner finner sin plass i et nytt hierarki.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Beni skal veies, og Alba er tilbake i isolasjon. Pujon tar tilbake plassen som gjengleder. Et team drar ut for å redde en nyfødt orangutang, og en uvelkommen gjest får staben til å undervise om hvor viktig det er å være oppmerksom på slanger.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Foreldreløse Josh er reddet, men må få undersøkt et brudd i håndleddet. Beni går til tannlegen for å få bukt med dårlig ånde. Alba er frisk etter tyfoidinfeksjonen og møter sine gamle venner igjen, men får en kjølig mottakelse.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Dette har aldri skjedd før på skogsskolen: Teamet møter et mystisk nytt dyr som viser seg å være en malayabjørn – verdens minste bjørn! Finn ut hvordan Danny Bear klarer seg i sine nye omgivelser.

programme.title: En livsreise
programme.desc: En livsreise. For alle arter på jorden er retten til å pare seg selve meningen med livet. Å videreføre genene sine til neste generasjon er arven til alle dyr. Men det er ikke enkelt. Det kan være vanskelig å finne en make og deretter slåss for å få tak i vedkommende. Det er bare de sterkeste og mest besluttsomme som vinner paringsleken i Luangwa.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Hver dag utspiller det seg en kamp for å overleve i Afrika. Rovdyr eter de døde, og naturens begravelsesagenter sirkler i luften og venter på sin sjanse. Når de mektige faller, kommer en hel hær for å fortære det andre legger igjen, for også de må forsørge familien.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Forfedrene deres var de første virveldyrene som bosatte seg på tørt land, og de finnes på alle kontinenter unntatt Antarktis, men deres verden forandrer seg raskt. 20 arter holder til i denne byen, men det som før var våtmark, er nå lekeplasser, golfbaner og veddeløpsbaner. Her klamrer de seg fast. Froskebestander over hele verden minker, og tiden er i ferd med å løpe ut.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Elefantene var en gang utbredt på kontinentet, men bestanden har blitt drastisk redusert av jakten på elfenben og kjøtt de siste 200 årene. Likevel finnes det glimt av håp for disse vennlige kjempene, i form av engasjerte elefantvernreservater som Addo Elephant Park og Tembe Elephant Park i Sør-Afrika. I parkene er elefantene beskyttet mot krypskyttere, og antallet øker.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Å overleve på savannen i Afrika krever snarrådighet og sluhet, spesielt for to av jegerne: den afrikanske villhunden og dvergmungoen. Disse to mystiske artene lever i flokk og er avhengig av nøye koordinert lagarbeid for å klare seg. Begge artene trenger den sammensveisede familien sin for å overvinne de daglige utfordringene, fra å ta seg av ungene til å finne mat og holde fiender på avstand.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Alt livet på jorden styres av et avansert nettverk av relasjoner. Alle arter er forbundet med hverandre, og ingen kan overleve alene. Selv om noen forhold er ensidige, er andre gjensidig nyttige. Alt har sin plass i naturens overordnede plan, fra løse forbindelser til nære partnerskap. Komplekse samhandlinger mellom arter er ikke en gang begrenset til dyrene, og noen av de beste eksemplene på dette finner vi i de frodige fjellskogene i Afrika.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Nilkrokodillen og flodhesten er to av Afrikas ikoniske amfibier som lever i ferskvann. De finnes i kanaler, elver og innsjøer på hele kontinentet, deriblant den storslåtte villmarken Kwa-Zulu Natal i Sør-Afrika. Disse to artene har eksistert side om side i tusenvis av år, og har utviklet seg på ulike måter til et liv i vann.

programme.title: En livsreise
programme.desc: En livsreise. For alle arter på jorden er retten til å pare seg selve meningen med livet. Å videreføre genene sine til neste generasjon er arven til alle dyr. Men det er ikke enkelt. Det kan være vanskelig å finne en make og deretter slåss for å få tak i vedkommende. Det er bare de sterkeste og mest besluttsomme som vinner paringsleken i Luangwa.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Hver dag utspiller det seg en kamp for å overleve i Afrika. Rovdyr eter de døde, og naturens begravelsesagenter sirkler i luften og venter på sin sjanse. Når de mektige faller, kommer en hel hær for å fortære det andre legger igjen, for også de må forsørge familien.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Forfedrene deres var de første virveldyrene som bosatte seg på tørt land, og de finnes på alle kontinenter unntatt Antarktis, men deres verden forandrer seg raskt. 20 arter holder til i denne byen, men det som før var våtmark, er nå lekeplasser, golfbaner og veddeløpsbaner. Her klamrer de seg fast. Froskebestander over hele verden minker, og tiden er i ferd med å løpe ut.

programme.title: Ikoniske villdyr
programme.desc: Ikoniske villdyr. Nilkrokodillen og flodhesten er to av Afrikas ikoniske amfibier som lever i ferskvann. De finnes i kanaler, elver og innsjøer på hele kontinentet, deriblant den storslåtte villmarken Kwa-Zulu Natal i Sør-Afrika. Disse to artene har eksistert side om side i tusenvis av år, og har utviklet seg på ulike måter til et liv i vann.

programme.title: Vulkanske reiser
programme.desc: Vulkanske reiser. For vulkanologen Tom Pfeiffer er all vulkansk aktivitet i Indonesia av interesse på grunn av landets beliggenhet i forhold til det største utbruddet i moderne historie – Krakatoa. Nå ser det ut til at Anak, sønn av Krakatoa, beveger seg inn i en mer voldsom fase, så Tom drar til Indonesia for å se om Ildens barn er klar til å gjenta mønsteret til sin forfar.

programme.title: Født i stormen
programme.desc: Iskald og frodande tuktar Nord-Atlanteren kystane rundt seg. Ei ugjestmild verd der berre dyr frå dei sterkaste ættene overlever. Vinteren slepp snart taket. På Island flørtar fjellreven, mens norske reinsdyr førebur seg på kalving. Men uver truar. Britisk naturserie. Vinteren slipper jerngrepet. På Island skynder fjellrevene seg over fjellene for å parre seg. I Shetland oppdrar en oter ungene sine. I Norge trekker reinsdyrene nedover til kalvingsområdene. En stor mars-storm treffer de stormfødtes landområder.

programme.title: Født i stormen
programme.desc: Iskald og frodande tuktar Nord-Atlanteren kystane rundt seg. Ei ugjestmild verd der berre dyr frå dei sterkaste ættene overlever. Vinteren slepp snart taket. På Island flørtar fjellreven, mens norske reinsdyr førebur seg på kalving. Men uver truar. Britisk naturserie. Opplev Nord-Atlanterens intense, korte sommer med dyrelivet der. Følg fjellrevens unger som lærer å jakte for å overleve, en oterunge som drar ut alene for første gang, en lundefugl som søker en make og et lite reinsdyr som tar sine første steg.

programme.title: Nykommere i villmarken
programme.desc: Nykommere i villmarken. Jaguarungen Frida tester grenser og finpusser overlevelsesevnene sine i Caiman Lodge naturreservat i Brasil. Hun lærer seg å snike seg fram sammen med mamma Gatuna, får hjelp av søster Anouk til å gjemme seg for sultne inntrengere, og tar en dumdristig tur alene som heldigvis ender godt.

programme.title: Gladiatorer
programme.desc: Det finnes dyr over hele jorden som er født til å slåss mot fiendene sine. Disse gladiatorene er forberedt på kamp og bevæpnet med våpen, list og taktikk. Bare vinnerne blir enerådende. Hei fram unge gladiatorer som må vise hva de kan i de tette tropiske skogene i Nord- og Sør-Amerika. Hold avstand når en pilgiftfrosk iverksetter et giftig bombardement, overvær en feide om territorium mellom en jaguar og en kaiman, og se en sulten nesebjørn støte på en defensiv tarantell.

programme.title: Gladiatorer
programme.desc: Det finnes dyr over hele jorden som er født til å slåss mot fiendene sine. Disse gladiatorene er forberedt på kamp og bevæpnet med våpen, list og taktikk. Bare vinnerne blir enerådende. Bli med til det høye nord i Nord-Amerika og møt de ultimate krigerne som lever langs vannveiene her. Se når vårsmeltingen starter konkurransen og setter ørner opp mot hegrer, bjørner opp mot bjørner og libeller opp mot giftige kjempevannteger.

programme.title: Afrikas ville horisonter
programme.desc: Afrikas ville horisonter. Provinsen Eastern Cape investerer tungt i økoturisme og bevaring som et alternativ til fiske og kommersiell utbygging. Regionen tar tilbake jordbruksland og stenger fiskeområder for dyreliv. Dette er en av de mest spennende suksesshistoriene om naturvern i Afrika.

programme.title: Orangutangskolen
programme.desc: Visste du at det finnes en orangutang som er albino? Det er bare rapportert om en eneste i hele verden, og den kommer til Orangutangskolen. Tenåringsmoren Clara og babyen hennes Clarita skal få dra tilbake til øyen de kom fra. Clara og ungen Clarita har blitt sterke nok til å flytte til Bangamatøya, men de får en fiendtlig mottakelse. Kasper er klar til å slippes fri, og kjendisen Taymur prøver å få en ny venn.

programme.title: a-ha - Unplugged: Summer Solstice
programme.desc: The first a-ha MTV Unplugged Concert ever. The album “MTV Unplugged – Summer Solstice” is being released including a very special LIVE experience.Share the impressive unplugged concert with a-ha in front of astonishing scenery on the picturesque island of Giske, located on the Norwegian coastline.Experience the concert including some hit singles like “Take On Me”, “The Sun Always Shines On TV”, and “The Living Daylights” as well as two new Songs. In June 2017, A-ha, the multi-platinum selling Norwegian trio, recorded a concert for the legendary MTV Unplugged series. The event was on the small Norwegian island of Giske during midsummer night.

programme.title: MTV Cribs
programme.desc: MTV Cribs ar en amerikansk dokumentarserie som erbjuds av MTV som tar oss med på en rundtur i kandisars hem. Skådespelerskan Ariel Winter visar upp sitt pokeransikte och sin ljusa Kalifornien-lya. OS-faktaren Miles Chamley-Watson visar oss sin flotta lagenhet i Los Angeles. Sen får vi se RandB-kungen Jacquees rymliga villa i Atlanta.

programme.sub-title: Kristin Cavallari; Leslie Jordan; Ray J

programme.title: MTV Cribs

programme.desc: Rob Dyrdek visar videoklipp från internet tillsammans med kandisgaster och programledarkollegorna Sterling "Steelo" Brim. I ett nytt avsnitt av Ridiculousness letar Rob, Steelo och Carly Aquilino efter Små satungar, ordnar sina Sjuka samlingar och får några nya Toavanner.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob Dyrdek visar videoklipp från internet tillsammans med kandisgaster och programledarkollegorna Sterling "Steelo" Brim. I ett nytt Ridiculousness satter Rob, Steelo och Nina Agdal klovarna i Fotsnaror, utmanar fyllon på Fyllespurt och visar att inte alla ar ododliga i Inte i dag, doden.

programme.title: M is for Music
programme.desc: Hang med på en titt på de hetaste hitsen just nu. Har finns underbar musik for alla smaker. Njut av det.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Goya: Visions of Flesh and Blood
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Francisco Goya, considered the founder of modern art, is Spains most acclaimed artist. As well as a gifted observer of Spanish life and its turbulent past, he is a gifted portraitist and social commentator. With Goya, the art of portraiture reached new heights. This major exhibition at Londons National Gallery brings his genius back into the spotlight. Through a formidable collection of unique works and letters by Goya, we analyze the man himself and the world he painted.

programme.title: Masterpiece
programme.desc: A team of experts reveal the untold mysteries and surprising techniques behind some of the world’s most famous paintings in order to recreate them. Can the reconstruction ever live up the original? Can only a master create a masterpiece? Karel Appel’s father forced him to take over the hairdressing business, but Karel only wanted one thing: to become a painter. And he did: A great master ahead of his time, a world famous painter even. In 1949, when he was still unknown and penniless, he made "Child, Church, Animal". Actually nothing is known about the construction of this painting. Not more than you can discover at first sight. To find out more, we have to take a closer look at the work using a microscope. It seems as if the work consists of several layers.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: Fernand Khnopff - The master of the enigma
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to discover the exhibition "Fernand Khnopff - The master of the enigma" at the Petit Palais in Paris. The work that introduces the visit of the exhibition dedicated to this amazing artist is called "silence". The artist represented landscapes of his childhood in the Ardennes in France. But he also painted portraits, paintings representing his mother as his painting entitled "Listening to Schumann".

programme.title: You, Myself and Art
programme.sub-title: The Cold War, When Art Took Sides
programme.desc: Featuring more than 20 specialists this documentary series explores who we are through the medium of art, spanning from the earliest days of mankind and into the future. Featuring more than 20 specialists this documentary series explores who we are through the medium of art, spanning from the earliest days of mankind, through our collective history, past today and into the future. It discusses how and why we are influenced by art, who funds art to influence the way we think, if contemporary art still fulfills our creative needs and desires and what could become the art of tomorrow. Travel from New York to Paris and meet people who are, one way or another, connected to art. They are artists, art historians, anthropologists, sociologists, neuroscientists, curators and philosophers. For all of them, art is a passion, and they are here to share it with us.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Reputed to be the inventor of oil painting, the Flemish painter Jan van Eyck (1390-1441) is a major 15th century artist. He is considered to be the founder of western portraiture and practised this art meticulously. Look closely at the famous “Arnolfini Portrait” exposed at the National Gallery, where the circular mirror at the back of the room shows the artist’s reflection, or the beautiful “Virgin of Chancellor Rolin” exposed at the Louvre, a picture in which three arches open onto a river landscape.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Sketchbook
programme.desc: An intimate instructional documentary series, Sketchbook takes us onto the desks and into the lives of talented artists and animators. Each episode focuses on a single artist teaching us how to draw a single iconic character from a Walt Disney Animation Studios film. As we learn the steps to drawing these characters, we also discover that the artists themselves each have a unique story to tell about how they made their way to Disney and their chosen character. From the creators of Chefs Table, this exclusive experience will give viewers of all ages a new understanding of how these beloved characters come to life on screen while introducing them to a new cast of real-life characters along way. Raphael Federici (street artist), Marine Goodmorning (illustrator), Luca Fiore (cartoonist) and Harry Boudchicha (drawing teacher) reveal their best drawing techniques. Each episode focuses on a specific subject:movement, oil painting, shadows, hair... For the first 10 minutes, each artist gives a theoretical lesson illustrated by sketches. Then they each start working on their creation. Finally, they end with a debrief, comparingand explaining their techniques.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Lucian Freud, one of the most famous British painters of our time, is also one of the few twentieth-century artists to have portrayed himself so consistently in self-portraiture. His self-portraits provide a fascinating insight into both his personality and his development as a painter, from his first portrait in 1939 to his last. Through fascinating interviews with former models, friends and leading experts, this intensely captivating documentary reveals the work of a master who represents a compelling study of the dynamics of aging and the process of self-representation.

programme.title: We are Artists not Vandals
programme.desc: Follow the artists who dress the streets from the ground to the walls. In each episode, we will introduce you to one or several street artists who will make you discover their passion or their work for some. The street art is an artistic movement and a mode of expression, which asserts itself or claims so from the end of the 20th century. However, some people still find it difficult to consider it as a real art form. We will try to prove them wrong.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: Caravaggio in Rome: friends and enemies
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to discover the "Caravaggio" exhibition at the Jacquemart Andre Museum in Paris.This is the first exhibition of the artist in Paris since 1965 and includes some of his masterpieces such as "Judith Beheading Holofernes". This provocative Italian painter was a still life specialist and this is what we will see in works such as "The Lute Player".

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a French painter, Eugene Delacroix.You will discover his labour with The barque of Dante, Portrait of Aspasie, The assassination of the bishop of liege.

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a French painter, Edgar Degas.You will discover his labour with Portrait of hilaire rene Degas, race horses, ballet rehearsal on the set.

programme.title: Video Art
programme.desc: Street art, performances, digital art... Because the new forms of Art and their invigorating character, even iconoclastic, have been able to attract a new public until now refractory to go inside the interior of our beautiful museums.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Comedy legend Jennifer Saunders and best pal, top actress Patricia Potter take to the road on a humdinger of a trip. Joined by veteran antiquers Phillip Serrell and Mark Stacey they shop in Berkshire, Hampshire and Oxfordshire before heading for an auction in Greenwich, London. Jennifer and Phil detour to hear about Fred Karno, the man credited with inventing slapstick comedy. While Patricia and Mark learn how a surgeon from Reading used his incredible sense of smell to successfully treat soldiers injured in World War One.And, Phil gets custard pied – what’s not to love?

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Although Degas’ art is difficult to classify, it is often associated with the impressionist movement, which emerged in France at the end of the 19th century. Nevertheless, he developed a very personal style with a preference for indoors subjects rather than the open-air scenes favoured by the impressionist painters. The 10 masterpieces presented here are a good illustration of Degas’ preferred themes: the show, the bath, family portraits and the working classes.Discover " The Ballet classe " exposed at the Orsay Museum or the " Blue Dancers " at the Fine arts Museum Pouchkine.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Little Sketches
programme.desc: In 64 fun episodes, Gia-Haï Phan teaches you all the sketching techniques you need.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. In June 2017, a major exhibition opened in Paris at the Musee dOrsay. For the first time, this exhibition brought together all Cezannes portraits. This was an opportunity to analyze Cezannes work with the help of international experts and to tour the rooms of the National Portrait Gallery in London and the National Gallery of Art in Washington.

programme.title: Putiphars travel guide
programme.desc: Petrus Putiphar is a travel guide author. This professional traveller locates the good places to visit like museums, gardens and places to go, he surveys the city, while sharing his discoveries and giving his observations. We follow him in his wanderings in the huge capitals of the 19th century like Paris, London, Vienna, Constantinople, Amsterdam or Saint Petersburg.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. A native of the southern French town of Grasse, Jean-Honore Fragonard is one of the most important 18th century French painters. He studied at the French Academy in Rome but chose to be free in his work, preferring to carry out private commissions, some of which were licentious, such as “The Shirt Withdrawn” exposed at the Louvre. The “Fanciful Figure” exposed at the Louvre-Lens demonstrates an original and very modern style. One of his masterpieces is without doubt the painting “The Bolt”, in the collection of the Louvre in Paris.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Musee dOrsay - A Great metamorphosis
programme.desc: With its immense 175-metre long hall, Orsay houses the largest collection of Impressionist art in the world. Inaugurated on 1 December 1986 by François Mitterrand, the stone and steel building has been a classified historical monument since 1978.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! programme.title: Masterpiece
programme.sub-title: Johannes Vermeer - Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: A team of experts reveal the untold mysteries and surprising techniques behind some of the world’s most famous paintings in order to recreate them. Can the reconstruction ever live up the original? Can only a master create a masterpiece? Vermeer’s ‘Girl with the Pearl Earring’ was chosen by the public as the most beautiful painting in the Netherlands. It is also called the Mona Lisa of the low countries. The artwork has an incredibly beautiful light and almost inscrutable build-up of paint layers. What technique did Vermeer use to achieve this? The course of light and sharpness is unprecedented for its time. And is the pearl a pearl? The team will try to unravel these secrets by re-creating the painting with all the technology of today and knowledge of the past. Masterpiece faces many challenges in the search for Vermeers secret.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. William Turner is known throughout the world as one of the best landscape painters of the English school. He strived to represent landscapes in what was qualified as a romantic style. As his artistic creations progressed, which are revealed here, Turner gave himself over to greater fantasy and boldness in his treatment of colour and light, verging on the imaginary in such a way as to be considered today as one of the precursors of impressionism. Discover his masterpiece exposed at the National Gallery such as " The Fighting Temeraire " or at the Boston Museum of Fine arts with " The Negrier ".Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: You, Myself and Art
programme.desc: Featuring more than 20 specialists this documentary series explores who we are through the medium of art, spanning from the earliest days of mankind and into the future. Featuring more than 20 specialists this documentary series explores who we are through the medium of art, spanning from the earliest days of mankind, through our collective history, past today and into the future. It discusses how and why we are influenced by art, who funds art to influence the way we think, if contemporary art still fulfills our creative needs and desires and what could become the art of tomorrow. Travel from New York to Paris and meet people who are, one way or another, connected to art. programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Two luvvies from the world of stage and TV, Ruth Madoc and Su Pollard, best known for their appearances in sitcom Hi-De-Hi, are antique hunting with Phil Serrell and Raj Bisram. Setting off from the Welsh border town of Monmouth they head for auction in Congleton, Cheshire. Ruth also gets to find out about the incredible 19th century nurse – and it’s not Florence Nightingale – whilst Su visits ancient Roman town Caerleon and finds time for an amphitheatre showdown with Phil. And Su attempts to resolve an age old mystery...does Phil wear a wig?

programme.title: Putiphars travel guide
programme.desc: Petrus Putiphar is a travel guide author. This professional traveller locates the good places to visit like museums, gardens and places to go, he surveys the city, while sharing his discoveries and giving his observations. We follow him in his wanderings in the huge capitals of the 19th century like Paris, London, Vienna, Constantinople, Amsterdam or Saint Petersburg. We will visit London, from the 19th century to the present day. London was previously the capital of the Empire on which we said “the sun never sets” with its colonies accounting for a quarter of the worlds population. The giant city has many secrets: from the chic shop windows to the noisy speakers corner, from the Crystal Palace to the Big Ben. At the cutting edge of modernity, the worlds first subway transports us to wonderful places.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Without Camille Pissarro, there is no Impressionist movement. He is rightfully known as the father of Impressionism.It was a dramatic path that Pissarro followed, and throughout it all he wrote extensively to his family. It is through these intimate and revealing letters that this gripping film reveals Pissarro’s life and work.Born in the West Indies, Pissarro found his passion in paint as a young man in Paris, and by the age of 43 had corralled a group of enthusiastic artists into a new collective. Their first show was scorned by the critics, but the group had acquired a new name: the Impressionists. For the next 40 years Pissarro was the driving force behind what has today become the world’s favourite artistic movement.The Ashmolean Museum has a long tradition of excellence. As the UK’s first ever public museum (it opened its doors in May 1683) it houses a wonderfully rich collection, including the remarkable Pissarro archive. With exclusive access to most extensive archive of.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Born in 1866 in Moscow, Wassily Kandinsky is considered as one of the most important 20th century artists. He was notably the founder of abstract art. Having left Russia for Germany where he started teaching at the Bauhaus in 1922, he then settled in France in 1933 and left behind him a particularly abundant work. You will rediscover here his most emblematic creations, essentially drawn from the collection of the Centre Pompidou in Paris.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Draw me what you see
programme.desc: The talented illustrator Fred Benaglia shares his vision of drawing and gives us practical advice, for young and old drawers! The talented illustrator Fred Benaglia shares his vision of drawing and gives us practical advice, for young and old drawers! A pencil and a sheet of paper, you dont need much material to make a drawing you can be proud of! To achieve this, you will be guided by Fred Benaglia, creator of Adelidelo, the mischievous little heroine of Pomme dApi. Fabulous beings or objects will appear in no time: a horse, a car, a dragon, a tree, a dog, a princess, a cat, a flower, a witch, a magician...

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Discover the extraordinary history of a painting, perhaps one of the smallest known formats of the Dutch master. It is preserved today in the collections of the museum of Tours. This small painting painted in 1627 when Rembrandt was just 21 years old, marks a turning point in the style of the young painter, it is one of his first chiaroscuro, a revolution in the history of painting. The painting disappeared for nearly 150 years before reappearing in the 18th century in several auctions. It was found a century later in a private collection in Touraine.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Legends of stage and screen, Charles Dance and Geraldine James join antiques experts Natasha Raskin and Will Axon on this Road Trip romp around Wiltshire. Charles finds a pair of Edwardian silver vases he hopes will prove profitable at an auction in Essex. Geraldine, however, bumps into a chap in the street with a 19th Century French Empire secretaire. It costs her a small fortune – will the gamble pay off? A diversion from the shops sees Charles end up in the cockpit of a very old helicopter while Geraldine learns how a small part of Swindon dating back 170 years influenced the creation of the modern NHS.

programme.title: Museum Tour
programme.sub-title: War and Peace - In the eye of Pablo Picasso
programme.desc: Museum Tour is a series that invites the viewer to discover unique which, for the artists chosen, have been incubators of creativity and a source of inspiration. Under their patronage, some of those sites have been turned into museums or foundations where their memory and work have picked up a life of their own.Each of the episodes will tell the story uniting the artist with a particular place, seeking intimacy in the process.This show’s agenda is decidedly visual. Works of art and the places in which they’re set will be filmed in such a way as to arouse strong emotions, thus placing the viewer in the spot, as if they were present in the flesh. This angle for the spectacular and search for beauty will enhance the accessibility of the series for an uninformed audience.A family-friendly documentary series which, beyond the fascinating information provided, offers a sight, sound and emotional journey into a captivating, palpable and contemporary form.

programme.title: Travelers
programme.desc: Travelers is the "city guide" for art lovers ... But not only that. Exhibitions, museums, galleries, artists but also hotels, restaurants, bars and shops ... In short, everything you need to prepare for your next weekend is in Travelers. Today, Travelers takes you to Bordeaux, France, the city of caneles, wine, and the Garonne River. Well start the tour at the Place de la Bourse and its "water mirror

programme.title: Art Quiz
programme.desc: Test your knowledge and your memory in fine arts, architecture, photography, street art and a dozen other topics with our Art Quiz popups !

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. He is one of the most controversial artists, yet one of the most influential. Picassos collection contained mainly Renoirs. Matisse revered him. Monet too. Renoir was crucial to the creation of the Impressionist movement, before rejecting it altogether to embark on a radically different genre, with great success. The Barnes Collection in Philadelphia has more paintings by Renoir than any other gallery in the world, and its here that well attempt to lift the veil on the remarkable story of this incredible artist.

programme.title: Masterpiece
programme.desc: A team of experts reveal the untold mysteries and surprising techniques behind some of the world’s most famous paintings in order to recreate them. Can the reconstruction ever live up the original? Can only a master create a masterpiece? It was not until he was 27 that Vincent van Gogh decided to become a fulltime artist. And yet, in the ten years until his death he made more than 900 paintings. His influence on painting has been enormous. His use of color and compositions have inspired generations after him. The team of Masterpiece examines the paintings and finds everything between the layers. And if they are lucky, they might discover something special. We know a lot about Van Gogh’s life through correspondence with his brother. But exactly what he looked like remains a mystery. If we strip the self-portrait of the characteristic lines, we have a change to look this masterpainter in the eye….

Bamboo art in Japan appeared quite late but continues today thanks to contemporary artists. Throughout this exhibition we will be able to observe works from different periods of this movement.

Each episode focuses on a specific subject:movement, oil painting, shadows, hair... For the first 10 minutes, each artist gives a theoretical lesson illustrated by sketches. Then they each start working on their creation. Finally, they end with a debrief, comparingand explaining their techniques.

As we learn the steps to drawing these characters, we also discover that the artists themselves each have a unique story to tell about how they made their way to Disney and their chosen character. programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. The story of Christs death and resurrection has dominated Western culture for 2,000 years. It is probably one of the most significant events in history, found in the Gospels as well as in the paintings of the greatest artists. This feature film explores the story of Easter in art, from the time of the first Christians to the present day. Shot in Jerusalem, the United States and Europe, the film explores the different representations of Easter through the ages, providing a portrait of our shared history.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: Emil Buhrle collection at the Maillol Museum
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to discover the Emil Buhrle collection at the Maillol Museum in Paris.This collection is that of Emil Buhrle, a student of art history who became passionate about collecting Monets works after a visit to the National Gallery in Berlin. He started his collection with works by Claude Monet, but continued to fill it with works by Cezanne, Gauguin... Works that you can observe during this visit.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.sub-title: Modern Japanese Prints, waves of revival to the Fondation Custodia
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to discover the "Waves of revival" exhibition about 20th century Japanese art at the Fondation Custodia in Paris. You will discover the works of artists such as Kanae Yamamoto, a Japanese artist who was inspired by French art when he arrived in France. But we will also present works with very Japanese influences such as the prints of Hashiguchi Goyo.

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a Netherland painter, Vincent van Gogh.You will discover his labour with Self-portrait, Memory of the garden at Etten, Van Gogh’s chair.

programme.title: An hour with
programme.desc: Classical, Modern, Contemporary Art… From ancient to contemporary art, discover the masterpieces and the artists of today. Take an hour break to discover the work of a Russian painter, Vassily Kandinsky. You will discover his labour with Old city n°2, Park of Saint-cloud, Rider (improvisation n°12).

programme.title: Video Art
programme.desc: Street art, performances, digital art... Because the new forms of Art and their invigorating character, even iconoclastic, have been able to attract a new public until now refractory to go inside the interior of our beautiful museums.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Legends of stage and screen, Charles Dance and Geraldine James join antiques experts Natasha Raskin and Will Axon on this Road Trip romp around Wiltshire. Charles finds a pair of Edwardian silver vases he hopes will prove profitable at an auction in Essex. Geraldine, however, bumps into a chap in the street with a 19th Century French Empire secretaire. It costs her a small fortune – will the gamble pay off? A diversion from the shops sees Charles end up in the cockpit of a very old helicopter while Geraldine learns how a small part of Swindon dating back 170 years influenced the creation of the modern NHS.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Possibly the most renowned painter in the world, Vincent van Gogh was born in Holland in 1853 but spent most of his life in France. Suffering from mental instability, Van Gogh produced more that 2,000 paintings before committing suicide aged 37. You will discover during this visit some of his most famous masterpieces, in particularly two “Self-portraits” at the Orsay Museum, “Sunflowers” exposed at the National Gallery in London, “Starry Night” and the “Church at Auvers-sur-Oise”.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Artists Workshop
programme.desc: In the Artists workshop series, we offer you a privileged meeting with an artist, or the discovery of an artist or an important place for the history of art. Whether they are painters, visual artists, sculptors... These people all have the same passion for art and this show is an opportunity to enter their different universes, to discover what drives them, inspires them and maybe that will give rise to vocations. François Boucq draws from morning to night in his studio, alone, as if he wanted to be more closely involved with his characters, moving from the savagery of the American West to the diplomacy of the Vatican, from the urban jungle to the news of the daily press. He has been drawing for 40 years with realism, with a precise and detailed line, a graphic finesse that makes him one of the undisputed masters of todays comics.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.sub-title: Venus And Cupid With Vulcan - Rubens
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. "Venus and Cupid in the Forge of Vulcan" of Rubens is a masterpiece of the Royal Museums of Brussels. This painting has completely changed in size, shape and meaning since its creation. The painter first enlarged it to paint the whole right side with Venus and Cupid. But the left part has been replaced by a fake! It is therefore a half Rubens... Why did Rubens enlarge his first painting? What had he painted initially? The investigation will lead us to Brussels and Antwerp in Belgium, to the Het Loo Palace in the Netherlands and to Dresden in Germany.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Legends of stage and screen, Charles Dance and Geraldine James join antiques experts Natasha Raskin and Will Axon on this Road Trip romp around Wiltshire. Charles finds a pair of Edwardian silver vases he hopes will prove profitable at an auction in Essex. Geraldine, however, bumps into a chap in the street with a 19th Century French Empire secretaire. It costs her a small fortune – will the gamble pay off? A diversion from the shops sees Charles end up in the cockpit of a very old helicopter while Geraldine learns how a small part of Swindon dating back 170 years influenced the creation of the modern NHS.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Exhibition on Screen takes us through the streets of Paris and then to the heart of a superb exhibition at Cambridges Fitzwilliam Museum, whose impressive collection of Degas works is the most representative in Britain. Having benefited from exclusive access to a wide variety of rare works, the film tells the story of Degas quest for perfection through experimentation.

programme.title: Private Tour
programme.desc: For everyone who haven’t a chance to go to the museum, "Private Tour" propose you a private tour in 13 minutes to the best exposition of the moment with a professionnal or an expository commissioner. Private Tour takes you to discover the exhibition "The Pushkin Museum: five hundred years of master drawings" at the Fondation Custodia in Paris. The works are displayed in such a way that visitors can observe the evolution of drawings over five centuries. There are drawings by the Italian artist Frederico Zuccari (or Zuccaro) but also the Dutch artist Peter Paul Rubens.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Little Sketches
programme.desc: In 64 fun episodes, Gia-Haï Phan teaches you all the sketching techniques you need.

programme.title: Sketchbook

programme.title: Putiphars travel guide
programme.desc: Petrus Putiphar is a travel guide author. This professional traveller locates the good places to visit like museums, gardens and places to go, he surveys the city, while sharing his discoveries and giving his observations. We follow him in his wanderings in the huge capitals of the 19th century like Paris, London, Vienna, Constantinople, Amsterdam or Saint Petersburg. We will visit Lisbon, from the 19th century until today. Phoenix city, Lisbon transports us in its seven hills. Lets get lost in the old neighbourhoods, among the steep streets, the vaulted passages, lets admire the azulejos that decorate the frontages of the buildings and lets taste the Lisbon pleasures, the pasteis de nata of Belem. Lisbon is a city known for its wonderful landscapes and surroundings where we fall in love.

programme.title: The decisive moment
programme.desc: In each episode of the decisive moment, we welcome a photographer whom we have asked to select three photos that have marked their life and their career. Whether they are reporters, portraitists or fashion photographers, they all have the same passion and will share it with us. In this episode, well be talking with Jennifer Khordi, photographer. She is a former computer professional from the Bronx. She started with street photography in the late 1980s and then moved into travel and portrait photography. She has spent the last few years photographing the moon, the Milky Way and New York City.

programme.title: Graffiti World
programme.desc: Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Graffiti World is a short program dedicated to contemporary urban art around the world. Each episode explores a specific city, highlighting iconic works of street art. Local soundscape accompanies the images for an authentic, commentary-free immersion. The program showcases the creativity and diversity of artistic expression in public spaces. An invitation to discover the richness of graffiti as an art form in its own right.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. Reputed to be the inventor of oil painting, the Flemish painter Jan van Eyck (1390-1441) is a major 15th century artist. He is considered to be the founder of western portraiture and practised this art meticulously. Look closely at the famous “Arnolfini Portrait” exposed at the National Gallery, where the circular mirror at the back of the room shows the artist’s reflection, or the beautiful “Virgin of Chancellor Rolin” exposed at the Louvre, a picture in which three arches open onto a river landscape.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Museum stories
programme.desc: From the most far creation to the most recent, discover a new museum to travel in a different part of the history. Before entering the old 19th century mansion which houses the Jean-Jacques Henner museum, it should be noted that it once belonged to another painter, contemporary of Henner: Guillaume Dubufe. The interest of the museum is thus twofold. On the one hand, the visitor takes a trip back in time through the specifics of a mansion built and decorated under the 3rd Republic. On the other, it reveals the work of Jean Jacques Henner, considered at the turn of the 20th century as one of the most important of his time.

programme.title: Museum stories
programme.desc: From the most far creation to the most recent, discover a new museum to travel in a different part of the history. There are few artists who, during their lifetime, prepare the posterity of their work with meticulousness, secrecy and determination. The symbolist painter Gustave Moreau, born in 1826, is one of them. In this museum that he created with his hand, his paintings are available to us, more than a century after his death, and tell us the story of a tormented and enigmatic man, borrowed from a mysticism that will one of the most important painters of the Symbolist movement.

programme.title: A special day
programme.desc: Museum takes you behind the scenes of prestigious institutions and lets you experience a special day by immersing yourself in the daily life of an art world professional. In this episode, we will spend a special day with Fanny Bouyagui, visual artist and director of the association Art Point M, and who is at the origin of the Braderie de lArt in Roubaix. Since 1991, this event welcomes dozens of artists with a single motto, create from recycled objects. But before the arrival of the public, Fanny must make sure that certain rules are respected. We will accompany her throughout this very busy day.

programme.title: A special day
programme.desc: Museum takes you behind the scenes of prestigious institutions and lets you experience a special day by immersing yourself in the daily life of an art world professional. In this episode, we will spend a special day with Gregoire Lacroix, director of the antique decents department of the auction house, Aguttes. We meet him at the Hôtel Drouot in Paris, the largest auction house in the world. For several months, he has been working on two important sales and we are going to accompany him during the last hours of preparations.

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Leonardo from the National Gallery London
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. A remarkable event occurred at London’s National Gallery when the largest ever collection of Leonardo’s surviving paintings was assembled in a unique exhibition: Leonardo da Vinci: Painter at the Court of Milan. Leonardo is recognised as perhaps the greatest painter and sculptor of all time but there was no end to his talents. This film tells his life story and expands on Leonardo the visionary and inventor from the place where he lived out his final years at Château du Clos Luce in France, concluding that Leonardo da Vinci was perhaps the very embodiment of the spirit of the Renaissance.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.sub-title: Apollo Revealing His Divinity Before The Shepherdess Isse - Boucher
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. In 1750, François Boucher was the official court painter, he painted "Apollo Revealing His Divinity To The Shepherdess Isse". His multiple works wonderfully express the reign of Louis XV who appointed him painter to the king in 1765. He painted Apollo revealing his divinity to Isse. Who is the female character represented in this work? Who really commissioned and paid for it? We know that the painting arrived in Tours after a revolutionary seizure in 1794 at the Chanteloup castle, but what was its route between 1750 and 1794? What is the relationship between Bouchers painting and the libretto by the composer Destouches? Through this painting we will learn more about the history of the great favourite of King Louis XV.

programme.title: My little Museum
programme.desc: My little Museum is Art History retold through funny anecdotes and backstage trivias by Alicia Flipo. With her wacky demeanor, her inventiveness and her quirky sense of humor, Alicia stages these small Art tales so that once and for all, you could remember the Big stories!

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Two luvvies from the world of stage and TV, Ruth Madoc and Su Pollard, best known for their appearances in sitcom Hi-De-Hi, are antique hunting with Phil Serrell and Raj Bisram. Setting off from the Welsh border town of Monmouth they head for auction in Congleton, Cheshire. Ruth also gets to find out about the incredible 19th century nurse – and it’s not Florence Nightingale – whilst Su visits ancient Roman town Caerleon and finds time for an amphitheatre showdown with Phil. And Su attempts to resolve an age old mystery...does Phil wear a wig?

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts accompany celebrities on a road trip around the UK searching for treasures and competing to make the most money at auction. Legends of stage and screen, Charles Dance and Geraldine James join antiques experts Natasha Raskin and Will Axon on this Road Trip romp around Wiltshire. programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.sub-title: Painting the Modern Garden - Monet to Matisse
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Passionate about horticulture, Monet remains the undisputed master of garden painting in the history of art, but he was not alone. Artists such as Van Gogh, Bonnard, Picasso and Matisse used the garden as a strong theme in their work. These great artists, along with many other famous names, are brought together in an innovative exhibition from the Cleveland Museum of Art and the Royal Gallery of Arts in London. From the exhibition itself to the beauty of artists gardens such as Monets at Giverny, we take a journey to discover how the modern garden was used to explore radical and wondrous new ideas.

programme.title: Art investigation
programme.desc: Art Investigation is a documentary series, each episode is devoted to a particular work. Sculptures of severed heads are on display at the Granet Museum in Aix en Provence, among many other relics dating back to 300 BC. We will visit the archaeological site of the oppidum of Entremont. The capital of the Salyans. With the archaeologist Patrice Arcelin, we will get to know these Gauls better, to better understand their rites. Rituals common to many peoples throughout the world, as we will see with Yves Le Fur, the director of the collections of the Musee du quai Branly. This survey of art will take us back to a time when Gauls and Romans were fighting for territory but also sharing their cultures.

programme.title: Within the frame
programme.desc: Discover or re-discover the masterpieces of the greatest painters of history through our documentary series Within The Frame. From impressionists to surrealists, from Leonard Da Vinci to Paul Cezanne, every episode will immerge you into a virtual tour of a paintings collection. You will see the most impressive paintings ever made and wont miss a single detail. In the second half of the 19th century, Edouard Manet (1832-1883) showed great originality in his painting of historic scenes and portraiture of well-known figures, such as the novelist Zola and the poet Mallarme. Even if we cannot call him the first Impressionist, his leading role in the history of modern art must be emphasised. The scandals in 1863 caused by “The Luncheon on the Grass” or “Olympia” both exposed at the Orsay Museum effectively mark the beginning of modern painting.Enjoy your visit!

programme.title: Exhibition on Screen
programme.desc: Up close with the world’s most celebrated artists and artworks in the highly acclaimed Exhibition on Screen film series. Who was Frida Kahlo? Journey into the life of a true icon, discover her art and the truth behind her often turbulent life. The combination of interviews, commentary and a detailed exploration of Kahlos art offers a treasure trove of color and a feast of vitality. This intimate, personal documentary provides privileged access to her works, and sheds light on her feverish creativity, resilience and unparalleled thirst for life.

programme.sub-title: Prana Flow: Open Your Shoulders and Hips
programme.desc: Namaste Yoga. This vinyasa flow allows the practitioner to notice moments of stillness and transformation with every breath. Power and Prana calls for a constant presence of mind and steadiness of breath. It is in this state you learn when to stabilize and when to let go.

programme.title: My Zen Relaxation
programme.desc: Turn down the lights, kick your shoes back, take a cup of tea... Youre on MyZen TV, time to relax.

programme.title: Earth from Above
programme.desc: Earth from Above is a documentary series presented by the photographer Yann Arthus-Bertrand and inspired by his best-selling book, aimed at confronting and examining the main issues facing the planet. The story of our planet, so alive and so fragile, is told by men and women from all over the world, all committed and passionate. A portrait of our planet that is both magical and realistic, moving and ingenious. Feeding the family is the concern of billions of people every day on the planet and it has been completely forgotten. We will also see that we, as consumers, can change things by changing our eating habits because our health and sustainable development depend on it. We fly over Paris to discover the cultivated plains, the intensive breeding in the Beauce, the pesticides in Guadeloupe and the green Camargue where the ecosystem is threatened, until India where the limits of the green revolution are reached.

programme.title: Julies Frenchy Cookbook
programme.desc: Julies Frenchy Cookbook. Today, Julie sets on the roads of France to talk about an essential product on French tables: cheese. More than a gourmet craze, more than an end-of-meal treat, cheese is associated with French gastronomy, and is also recognized as Intangible Cultural Heritage by UNESCO. With nearly 1,000 varieties (soft cheeses, cooked, blue-veined, pressed cheeses…), the French are the biggest consumers of cheese in the world!

programme.title: Julies Frenchy Cookbook
programme.desc: Julies Frenchy Cookbook. Julie takes you through the Pyrenees Orientales, then Corsica, before making a stop on the Côte dAzur, and concludes her journey between Rungis and Paris... all to explore the world of citrus fruits! These fruits add flavor, zest, and seasoning to any recipe, making them indispensable in the kitchen. They bring the warmth and sunshine of the South of France and the exoticism of distant lands. While were all familiar with lemons, clementines, and grapefruits, Julie introduces us to a thousand other varieties.

programme.title: Health Explored with Mike Wahl
programme.sub-title: Japan - Okinawa - The Purpose of Life Part I
programme.desc: Health Explored delves deep into the subject of global health, revealing that well-being isn’t just an internal state but is also influenced by community, culture, a passion for helping others, and the capacity to challenge our own limits. This series is about health and our connection to the natural world, the resilience of the human spirit, and the ongoing quest to live a fulfilled, healthy life. Health is a journey and its mean to be explored! We travel to the Japanese island known for having some of the oldest people on Earth. We engage with leading scientists who have identified the "Longevity Gene," offering a glimpse into the genetic factors that contribute to extended lifespans. Beyond genetics, we explore the deeply ingrained cultural practices that sustain long, fulfilling lives in Okinawa. We delve into the importance of "moai," a lifelong social network that supports residents into their golden years, and the principle of "Hara Hachi Bu," which advises eating until youre 80% full while focusing on nourishing foods. But at the core of Okinawan longevity, we find "ikigai"—a profound sense of life purpose. From practicing martial arts to active community participation, we discover that Okinawan seniors maintain a vibrant sense of purpose in various facets of life. Join us on this enlightening journey to learn how the pillars of social support, mindful eating, and a strong sense of ikigai could enhance your ow.

programme.title: Born For This
programme.desc: Born For This aims to empower Filipinos by breaking the stigma surrounding mental health, spreading educational awareness and guidance on holistic practices, and building community connection and support. The Fuel to Flourish Fellowship is made up of health experts and practitioners whose mission is to empower people to take control of their bodies and minds. Their goal is to promote everyones right to well-being.

programme.title: The Wonderful World of Crafting
programme.desc: Passionate crafters are given the opportunity to turn their hobby into a business. Four passionate hobby crafters showcase their talents at the Crafty Vintage Fair at Lowther Castle in Penrith, Cumbria. From intricate needle-felt creations to imaginative plastic sculptures and beautifully crafted wooden furniture, each maker strives to turn their passion into success. This episode captures their creative journeys, the challenges they face, and the thrill of presenting their work at a prestigious fair. Will their crafts capture the hearts of visitors and lead to life-changing opportunities?

programme.title: Home training
programme.desc: Enjoy our tutorials and coaching, exercises, and practical lifestyle tips to help you live better. In this Home Training episode, Sabrina leads an explosive cardio boxing workout. After a full joint warm-up, the team walks you through punchy combos inspired by combat sports. It’s a great way to boost endurance, core strength, and coordination while letting off steam. With high energy and a fun vibe, you’ll barely notice how hard youre working. The perfect session to release tension and recharge!

programme.title: Yoga
programme.desc: Yoga is a practice that consists of a set of postures and breathing exercises to improve physical and mental well-being. Through these workouts, stop stress, improve your breathing, maintain your body, improve your flexibility and your ability to concentrate. Practice yoga in the comfort of your living room in the company of our Yogi experts. Practice Yoga from the comfort of your home with our experienced teatchers.

programme.title: Namaste Yoga
programme.sub-title: Reconnect and Refine: Hip Opening and Abdominal Strengthening
programme.desc: Namaste Yoga. Connect with the essence of your being with Reconnect and Refine. This exhilarating sequence encourages you to find comfort in the present moment, and let go of preconceived expectations or agendas. It is not about where you are going, but where you are.

programme.title: Vegetarian Delights
programme.desc: Keep calm and become vegetarian! It’s long been proved that a plant-based diet could prevent and even cure a lot of diseases. We believe that it’s not only mainstream, but it’s also a lifestyle which could turn around the attitude to food and the human body. Our carefully selected recipes will be a guide to the new healthy and peaceful life.

programme.title: Julies Frenchy Cookbook

programme.title: Health Explored with Mike Wahl
programme.sub-title: Norway - Friluftsliv (Open Air Life) Part II
programme.desc: Health Explored delves deep into the subject of global health, revealing that well-being isn’t just an internal state but is also influenced by community, culture, a passion for helping others, and the capacity to challenge our own limits. This series is about health and our connection to the natural world, the resilience of the human spirit, and the ongoing quest to live a fulfilled, healthy life. Health is a journey and its mean to be explored! A climb in the Lyngen Alps leads us to an untouched mountain summit, followed by a spectacular ski descent. We then dive into the icy Arctic waters to explore a unique underwater world, ending the day with a Norwegian sauna experience. This episode highlights the physical and mental benefits of connecting with the elements.

programme.title: My Day Dubai
programme.desc: Gabriela Miloda, our engaging presenter, invites you to the sumptuous palaces of a thousand and one nights where well-being was invented. She will show you the trendy activities for fitness or free time as a solo, couple or family. In addition, you will cook balanced dishes with the greatest chefs. Let us take you on this luxury trip to Dubai. Gabriela starts her day with a boat ride through the canals of the majestic Jumeirah Al Qasr Hotel. She then meets with chef Gabi for a healthy cooking class, as well as a fitness influencer with whom she will go on a fitness tour. She will end her day with a Thai massage in the hotels beautiful, lush garden.

programme.title: Origami
programme.desc: A square piece of paper and some patience, this is all you need to transform a flat surface into a superb tridimensional piece of art! Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: In the eyes of a champ
programme.desc: 5 champions, in 5 different disciplines, have set themselves a major challenge that they will try to achieve at all costs. We follow Violette Dorange, 19 years old, who has been sailing since she was a child. She started out in ocean racing, and her ultimate dream is really to do the Vendee Globe one day, why not the Olympics, and why not the Volvo Ocean Race, three big dreams, and thats a life goal.

Participants learn the steps progressively, with intensity building throughout the sets to finish strong. Guillaume and Sabrina encourage everyone to add their personal style and connect with the rhythm. This festive session is perfect for boosting cardio and having fun with family or friends.

programme.title: Home training
programme.desc: Enjoy our tutorials and coaching, exercises, and practical lifestyle tips to help you live better. This episode of "Home Training" offers a unique session centered on strengthening the lower body using a chair. After a progressive warm-up mobilizing the neck, shoulders, and hips, Guillaume and Sabrina guide participants to use the chair for a variety of exercises. The training targets the knees, legs, and glutes while incorporating stretches to improve posture and mobility. Each movement is guided with clear instructions to ensure effective and safe practice. This friendly and accessible session is perfect for strengthening the lower body while staying at home.
